de.systemagmbh.interfaces.logger
Interface ISysLogChecker

All Superinterfaces:
ISysComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
ASysLogChecker, DummyISysLogChecker
public interface ISysLogChecker
extends ISysComponent

Let's give a definition of a 'log check' first:
The 'log check' is the decision if a call of the log method has to be sent to a log writer or not. (see ISysLogWriter)
The ISysLogChecker is the interface, that has to be implemented to get a special 'log check'. It defines the method checkLog. This method is executing the check.
The init method is loading information about the check (like the levels that are valid for logging).

Version:
$Revision: 1.7 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich, Torsten Knauft

Method Detail

init

public void init(ISysConfigItem configItem)
          throws ASysException
Call this method to configure the checker from a section in the configuration.

Parameters:
configItem - The item in the configuration that contains the checker data.
Throws:
ASysException - if the items needed by the implementation are not available in the configuration.

checkLog

public boolean checkLog(String componentType,
                        int level,
                        Properties additionals)
This method defines the way, how a logger will format the log output.

Parameters:
componentType - The name of the application part that called the log method.
This is used for the component log levels!
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
level - The level that is used for logging the given text.
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
additionals - Additional Properties. These parameters may be checked also.
Returns:
true if the check was positive. That is the log entry has to be logged.
